snippet: A poem by Dorothy Margaret Stuart of Britain that won a 1924 Olympic bronze portrays fencing as “the clashing of the thin grey swords.”
lead_paragraph: A poem by Dorothy Margaret Stuart of Britain that won a 1924 Olympic bronze portrays fencing as “the clashing of the thin grey swords.”

headline.seo: When Poetry Was an Olympic Event
headline.main: Medals That Were Won Not in Pentathlon or 100 Meters, but in Iambic Pentameter
headline.print_headline: Medals That Were Won Not In Pentathlon or 100 Meters, But in Iambic Pentameter
